seg-source.mrk: startSlave=true attribute

target.mrk: startSlave=true attribute

target.mrk: startSlave=true database connection URL attribute

seg-source.mrk: replicating databases

target.mrk: replicating databases

seg-source.mrk: starting the slave

target.mrk: starting the slave

seg-source.mrk: database replication

target.mrk: database replication

seg-source.mrk: starting the slave

target.mrk: starting the slave

target.mrk: databases

target.mrk: attributes, starting the replication slave

seg-source.mrk: startSlave

target.mrk: startSlave

seg-source.mrk: Function

target.mrk: Function

trans-unit.source: Starts replication of a database in slave mode. Before you specify this attribute, you must cleanly shut down the database on the master system and then perform a file system copy of the database to the slave system.

seg-source.mrk: Starts replication of a database in slave mode.
Before you specify this attribute, you must cleanly shut down the database on the master system and then perform a file system copy of the database to the slave system.

target.mrk: Starts replication of a database in slave mode.
Before you specify this attribute, you must cleanly shut down the database on the master system and then perform a file system copy of the database to the slave system.

seg-source.mrk: The startSlave=true attribute does the following:

target.mrk: The startSlave=true attribute does the following:

seg-source.mrk: Partially boots the specified database

target.mrk: Partially boots the specified database

trans-unit.source: Starts to listen on the specified port and accepts a connection from the master

seg-source.mrk: Starts to listen on the specified port and accepts a connection from the master

target.mrk: Starts to listen on the specified port and accepts a connection from the master

trans-unit.source: Hangs until the master has connected to it

seg-source.mrk: Hangs until the master has connected to it

target.mrk: Hangs until the master has connected to it

trans-unit.source: Reports the startup status to the caller (whether it has started, and if not, why not)

seg-source.mrk: Reports the startup status to the caller (whether it has started, and if not, why not)

target.mrk: Reports the startup status to the caller (whether it has started, and if not, why not)

trans-unit.source: Continually receives chunks of the transaction log from the master and applies the operations in the transaction log to the slave database

seg-source.mrk: Continually receives chunks of the transaction log from the master and applies the operations in the transaction log to the slave database

target.mrk: Continually receives chunks of the transaction log from the master and applies the operations in the transaction log to the slave database

trans-unit.source: If replication is started successfully, an exception with the error code XRE08 is thrown. Hence, the startSlave=true attribute does not return a valid connection.

seg-source.mrk: If replication is started successfully, an exception with the error code XRE08 is thrown.
Hence, the startSlave=true attribute does not return a valid connection.

target.mrk: If replication is started successfully, an exception with the error code XRE08 is thrown.
Hence, the startSlave=true attribute does not return a valid connection.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the topics under "Replicating databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information, see the topics under "Replicating databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information, see the topics under "Replicating databases" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citadmin"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: Combining with other attributes

target.mrk: Combining with other attributes

trans-unit.source: You must specify a database name in the connection URL, either in the subprotocol or by using the databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute.

seg-source.mrk: You must specify a database name in the connection URL, either in the subprotocol or by using the databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute.

target.mrk: You must specify a database name in the connection URL, either in the subprotocol or by using the databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute.

trans-unit.source: You may specify this attribute in conjunction with the slaveHost=hostname attribute. If you do not specify the slaveHost=hostname attribute, the default value is localhost.

seg-source.mrk: You may specify this attribute in conjunction with the slaveHost=hostname attribute.
If you do not specify the slaveHost=hostname attribute, the default value is localhost.

target.mrk: You may specify this attribute in conjunction with the slaveHost=hostname attribute.
If you do not specify the slaveHost=hostname attribute, the default value is localhost.

trans-unit.source: You may also specify this attribute in conjunction with the slavePort=portValue attribute. If you do not specify the slavePort=portValue attribute, the default port value is 4851.

seg-source.mrk: You may also specify this attribute in conjunction with the slavePort=portValue attribute.
If you do not specify the slavePort=portValue attribute, the default port value is 4851.

target.mrk: You may also specify this attribute in conjunction with the slavePort=portValue attribute.
If you do not specify the slavePort=portValue attribute, the default port value is 4851.

trans-unit.source: If authentication is turned on, you must also specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes. If both authentication and SQL authorization are turned on, the user must be the database owner.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication is turned on, you must also specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes.
If both authentication and SQL authorization are turned on, the user must be the database owner.

target.mrk: If authentication is turned on, you must also specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes.
If both authentication and SQL authorization are turned on, the user must be the database owner.

trans-unit.source: You may not specify this attribute in conjunction with any attributes not mentioned in this section.

seg-source.mrk: You may not specify this attribute in conjunction with any attributes not mentioned in this section.

target.mrk: You may not specify this attribute in conjunction with any attributes not mentioned in this section.

seg-source.mrk: Examples

target.mrk: Examples

trans-unit.source: -- start slave using database name in subprotocol, default slave host -- and port, authorization jdbc:derby:myDB;startslave=true;user=mary;password=little88lamb

seg-source.mrk: -- start slave using database name in subprotocol, default slave host -- and port, authorization jdbc:derby:myDB;startslave=true;user=mary;password=little88lamb

target.mrk: -- start slave using database name in subprotocol, default slave host -- and port, authorization jdbc:derby:myDB;startslave=true;user=mary;password=little88lamb

trans-unit.source: -- start slave using databaseName attribute, non-default slave host -- and port, no security jdbc:derby:;databaseName=myDB;startSlave=true;slaveHost=localhost; slavePort=4852

seg-source.mrk: -- start slave using databaseName attribute, non-default slave host -- and port, no security jdbc:derby:;databaseName=myDB;startSlave=true;slaveHost=localhost; slavePort=4852

target.mrk: -- start slave using databaseName attribute, non-default slave host -- and port, no security jdbc:derby:;databaseName=myDB;startSlave=true;slaveHost=localhost; slavePort=4852
